Data for Xe Arc lamp spectrometer
=================================

There are two files for the arc lamp data:
160113_01.asc		Mercury emission lamp spectrum for wavelength calibration.
160113_02.asc		Time profile of arc lamp intensity through the spectrometer
Description of the acquisition parameters and experimental protocol are described below. The bottom on the file provides the approximate wavelength calibration based on 160113_01.asc spectrum.


160113_01.asc
=============
Acquisition parameters:
Spectrometer slit width = 25 micron
CCD camera exposure time = 0.010 s
CCD spectra averaged = 1
CCD temperature = -10 C
This is the wavelength calibration of the Xe arc lamp spectrometer.  Calibration was  based on mercury atomic emission lamp spectrum (file “160113_01.asc”). 
Columns are: Pixel number, intensity (scan 1)
Rows 1-1024 correspond to measurement at different pixels (and wavelengths).

160113_02.asc
=============
Acquisition parameters:
Spectrometer slit width = 25 micron
CCD camera exposure time = 0.010 s
CCD spectra averaged = 500    (=12.6 s per scan)
Total number of recorded spectra = 200
CCD temperature = -10 C
Time profile of the Xe arc lamp intensity transmitted through the cavity. Volumes  of 10, 6, and 2  microlitre biacetyl were injected into the inlet stream at approximately scans 70, 112, and 149. The lamp was blocked from scan 196 to 200.
Columns are: Pixel number, intensities (scan 1, scan 2, scan 3… up to scan 200)
Rows 1-1024 correspond to different pixels (and wavelengths).

Paper figures are based on 160113_02.asc data.
Fig. 1b: shows the intensity at scan 1 and scan 75 plotted against wavelength
Fig. 2b. shows the time profile of the intensity at 400 nm (pixel 721) against scan number (raw data) and data normalised based on the intensity at 215 nm (pixel 1).
Fig. 3b. shows the correlation between the intensity at 215 nm and 400 nm for scans 1-110 and 196-200. The background intensity (scan 200) was subtracted from the intensity at 215 nm. The baseline makes little difference to the intensity at 400 nm and was ignored.  For figure clarity, the 2 subsequent additions of biacetyl were not shown, but including them does not alter the findings of the paper.


WAVELENGTH CALIBRATION
======================
Pixel no.	Wavelength calibration (nm)	
1	214.94
2	215.21
3	215.48
4	215.75
5	216.01
6	216.28
